I think I know the answer to Question no.4:
I think Samurais veiw death as honor. If they die to
fulfill their duties, they die for honor...I think.
Only samurais can commit seppuku (suicide) because if
you are executed, then you die with shame or
disgrace...right?
-Cherry

--- dan_0033 <dan_0033@...> wrote:
> Hi, I am doing a research project on samurai for
> english class, and I 
> have to interview someone on the subject. Will
> someone please answer 
> the following questions:
> 
> 1. Can you give me some information on the orgin of
> the samurai?
> 
> 2. What was the final outcome of the civil war
> between the Taira clan 
> and the Minamoto clan?
> 
> 3. What weapons and armour were preferred by the
> samurai?
> 
> 4. How did the samurai view death?
> 
> 5. What eventually led to the downfall of the
> samurai?
> 
> Thanks
> 
> 
> 
>
